description: From Latin eglomero, eglomeratus, from e- + glomeratus.

verbs.description: eglomerate (third-person singular simple present eglomerates, present participle eglomerating, simple past and past participle eglomerated)

entries.meaning: (rare, transitive, intransitive) To unwind, as a thread from a ball.
examples: At another signal from Barelegs, their tails gradually eglomerated, and all joyfully made away from the shore, landing in the same order about seventy yards lower down.
